required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carboplatin, Taxane And Ramucirumab for Patients With NSCLC After Pemetrexed or Pembrolizumab Maintenance
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II, Single-Arm Study Of Carboplatin, Weekly Taxane, And Ramucirumab In Advanced Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Progressive Disease On Maintenance Pemetrexed And/Or Pembrolizumab

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the combination of the three anti-cancer drugs carboplatin, paclitaxel, and ramucirumab is helpful in shrinking tumors or delaying tumor growth in participants with non-small cell lung cancer. This study will also assess whether it is safe to combine these drugs.

primary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR) as determined by RECIST criteria. Response will be defined by a complete response (CR) or partial response (PRO), confirmed or unconfirmed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug until progressive disease, death or last assessment contact, whichever comes first, an average of 1-2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) defined as the duration from the first study dose of study drug until progressive disease, death or last assessment contact whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the first dose of study drug until death, last observation or contact, an average of 1-2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS) is defined as the time from the first dose of study drug until death due to any cause or last observation or contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Evaluations: number of Grade ≥ 3 as determined by CTCAE v 5.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Initiation through 30 days following the last administration of study treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicity will be estimated by the number of Grade ≥ 3 as determined by CTCAE v 5.0.

arm_group.description: Carboplatin AUC 5 IV every 3 wks, Paclitaxel 80 mg/m2 IV days 1 and 8 every 3 weeks, and Ramucirumab 10 mg/kg IV every 3 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced non-squamous NSCLC (Stage IV or recurrent after initial curative intent therapy) in adults age 18 or older
- Prior exposure to 4-6 cycles of Pem/Carbo/Pembro and PD after at least 18 weeks of maintenance Pemetrexed, Pembrolizumab or the combination of the two.
- PS 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of a driver mutation that is susceptible to targeted therapy
- Other active invasive malignancy requiring ongoing therapy
- Grade 2 or higher sensory neuropathy
- Evidence of untreated brain metastases
- History of bleeding diatheses or recent, antecedent hemoptysis (> 1/2 teaspoon in prior 2 months)

overall_official.affiliation: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

facility.name: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania
